# Exercises for the R-Beginner - The fancy calculator

## Exercise 2
* from https://alexd106.github.io/intro2R/exercise_2.html
```{r myN, echo=TRUE, include=TRUE}
myNumber <- 12.43

# do some calculations
# natural log
log(myNumber)
```

```{r lg10, echo=TRUE, include=TRUE}
# log10
log10(myNumber)
```

```{r lg10, echo=TRUE, include=TRUE}
# log10
log2(myNumber)
```
```{r myN, echo=TRUE, include=TRUE}
# squareroot
sqrt(myNumber)
```
```{r myN, echo=TRUE, include=TRUE}
#natural antilog 
exp(myNumber)
```

```{r, echo=TRUE, include=TRUE}

r <- 20/2
#area circle

```
```{r, echo=TRUE, include=TRUE}
#cube root
result <- (14*0.51)^(1/3)

```

```{r, echo=TRUE, include=TRUE}
#create a vector
weight <- c(69,62,57,59,64,56,66,67,66)

#display the vector
print (weight)
```
```{r, echo=TRUE, include=TRUE}
vec_mean <- mean (weight)
print(vec_mean)
```

```{r, echo=TRUE, include=TRUE}
var(weight)
sd (weight)
range(weight)
length(weight)
```
```{r, echo=TRUE, include=TRUE}
first_five <- weight [1:5]
print (first_five)
```
